Description: A bone cylinder: with very thin walls decorated with incised cross-hatching between an upper and lower horizontal line encircling the rim. An area of the surface has been left undecorated.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Mostagedda, Grave 2673 From a female burial
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 96; Tomb register. pl.XLV; pl.LX. I.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (220)
Condition: The cylinder is damaged at one side and there are chips missing from one rim.
